Package org.neo4j.internal.kernel.api

Interface SchemaWrite

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Operations, RestrictedSchemaWrite
    public interface SchemaWrite
    Surface for creating and dropping indexes and constraints.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • indexProviderByName

        IndexProviderDescriptor indexProviderByName​(String providerName)
        Translate an index provider name, into an IndexProviderDescriptor. This method is only used when creating indexes using custom or specific index providers. Normally, IndexType would be used instead, but this is not always accurate enough.
        Parameters:
        providerName - The name of the index provider to resolve the descriptor for.
        Returns:
        The provider descriptor with the given provider name.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if there is no index provider by the given name.

      • indexCreate

        IndexDescriptor indexCreate​(IndexPrototype prototype)
                     throws KernelException
        Create index using the given IndexPrototype.
        Parameters:
        prototype - the prototype specifying the relevant schema and configuration of the index to create.
        Returns:
        the IndexDescriptor for the created index.
        Throws:
        KernelException - if the index cannot be created for some reason.

      • indexCreate

        IndexDescriptor indexCreate​(SchemaDescriptor schema,
                            String name)
                     throws KernelException
        Create index from schema descriptor
        Parameters:
        schema - description of the index
        name - name of the index, or null to get a generated index name
        Returns:
        the newly created index
        Throws:
        KernelException

      • indexCreate

        IndexDescriptor indexCreate​(SchemaDescriptor schema,
                            IndexConfig indexConfig,
                            String name)
                     throws KernelException
        Create index from schema descriptor
        Parameters:
        schema - description of the index
        indexConfig - settings for this index
        name - name of the index, or null to get a generated index name
        Returns:
        the newly created index
        Throws:
        KernelException

      • indexCreate

        IndexDescriptor indexCreate​(SchemaDescriptor schema,
                            String provider,
                            IndexConfig indexConfig,
                            String name)
                     throws KernelException
        Create index from schema descriptor
        Parameters:
        schema - description of the index
        provider - name of the desired index provider implementation, never null
        indexConfig - settings for this index
        name - name of the index, or null to get a generated index name
        Returns:
        the newly created index
        Throws:
        KernelException

      • indexDrop

        void indexDrop​(IndexDescriptor index)
        throws SchemaKernelException
        Drop the given index
        Parameters:
        index - the index to drop
        Throws:
        SchemaKernelException

      • indexDrop

        void indexDrop​(SchemaDescriptor schema)
        throws SchemaKernelException
        Drop an index that matches the given schema.
        Parameters:
        schema - the schema matching the index to drop
        Throws:
        SchemaKernelException

      • indexDrop

        void indexDrop​(String indexName)
        throws SchemaKernelException
        Drop the index by the given name.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index to drop.
        Throws:
        SchemaKernelException

      • uniquePropertyConstraintCreate

        ConstraintDescriptor uniquePropertyConstraintCreate​(IndexPrototype prototype)
                                             throws KernelException
        Create a unique property constraint based on the given uniqueness index prototype. The given index prototype will be used for creating the uniqueness index backing the constraint.
        Parameters:
        prototype - a prototype that describes the constraint index, and includes the schema of the constraint.
        Returns:
        The ConstraintDescriptor of the created constraint.
        Throws:
        KernelException - if the constraint cannot be created for some reason.

      • nodeKeyConstraintCreate

        ConstraintDescriptor nodeKeyConstraintCreate​(IndexPrototype prototype)
                                      throws KernelException
        Create node key constraint based on the given uniqueness index prototype. The given index prototype will be used for creating the uniqueness index backing the constraint.
        Parameters:
        prototype - the index prototype for which to create a node key constraint.
        Returns:
        the created constraint.
        Throws:
        KernelException - if the constraint cannot be created for some reason.

      • nodePropertyExistenceConstraintCreate

        ConstraintDescriptor nodePropertyExistenceConstraintCreate​(LabelSchemaDescriptor schema,
                                                           String name)
                                                    throws KernelException
        Create node property existence constraint
        Parameters:
        schema - description of the constraint
        Throws:
        KernelException

      • relationshipPropertyExistenceConstraintCreate

        ConstraintDescriptor relationshipPropertyExistenceConstraintCreate​(RelationTypeSchemaDescriptor schema,
                                                                   String name)
                                                            throws KernelException
        Create relationship property existence constraint
        Parameters:
        schema - description of the constraint
        Throws:
        KernelException

                    ConstraintType type)
             throws SchemaKernelException
        Drop a constraint with the given schema.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        SchemaKernelException
